1.english: “Then the Kingdom of Heaven will be like ten virgins, who took their lamps, and went out to meet the bridegroom.
1.wedau: [“then]  vibadana ana marei ina  [like] [ten] [virgins] aiyai varahai ahi [lamps] ma nae hopu da [meet]  [bridegroom]
1.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.78); Strong secondary: Wisdom

2.english: Five of them were foolish, and five were wise.

3.english: Those who were foolish, when they took their lamps, took no oil with them,
3.wedau: raketana aiyai  [foolish] maranaina tauhi varahai ahi [lamps] varahai egha [oil] maitehi hita

4.english: but the wise took oil in their vessels with their lamps.
4.wedau: tuna  [wise] varahai [oil] au ahi [vessels] maitehi ahi [lamps]

5.english: Now while the bridegroom delayed, they all slumbered and slept.

6.english: But at midnight there was a cry, ‘Behold! The bridegroom is coming! Come out to meet him!’
6.wedau: tuna au [midnight] kampa   [cry] [‘behold!]  [bridegroom]  [coming!] neꞌi hopu da [meet] [him!’]

7.english: Then all those virgins arose, and trimmed their lamps.

8.english: The foolish said to the wise, ‘Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.’
8.wedau: [foolish] riwa da  [wise] [‘give] ita ghehauhi ana ami [oil] yamna ahi [lamps]  nae [out’]

9.english: But the wise answered, saying, ‘What if there isn’t enough for us and you? You go rather to those who sell, and buy for yourselves.’
9.wedau: tuna  [wise] [answered] riwa ipa [‘what] tora kampa [isn’t] [enough] yamna ita ma [you?] omi nae [rather] da raketana aiyai [sell] ma [buy] yamna [yourselves’]

10.english: While they went away to buy, the bridegroom came, and those who were ready went in with him to the wedding feast, and the door was shut.
10.wedau: [while] tauhi nae [away] da [buy]  [bridegroom] neꞌi ma raketana aiyai  [ready] nae au maitehi tauna da  [wedding] [feast] ma  naona  [shut]

11.english: Afterward the other virgins also came, saying, ‘Lord, Lord, open to us.’
11.wedau: [afterward]  ghehauna [virgins] maitehi neꞌi riwa ipa [‘lord] Guyau [open] da [us’]

12.english: But he answered, ‘Most certainly I tell you, I don’t know you.’
12.wedau: tuna tauna [answered] [‘most] [certainly] tau riwehi omi tau [don’t] haramaneꞌi [you’]

13.english: Watch therefore, for you don’t know the day nor the hour in which the Son of Man is coming.
13.wedau: [watch] [therefore] yamna omi [don’t] haramaneꞌi  mara [nor]  [hour] au aiyai  natuna ana oroto  naenae

14.english: “For it is like a man, going into another country, who called his own servants, and entrusted his goods to them.
14.wedau: [“for] tauna  [like]  oroto nae au [another] [country] aiyai ghorehi ana ana taunoya ma [entrusted] ana [goods] da hita

15.english: To one he gave five talents, to another two, to another one; to each according to his own ability. Then he went on his journey.
15.wedau: da [one] tauna verei [five] [talents] da [another] [two] da [another] [one;] da tagotagogi [according] da ana ana [ability] maratagogi tauna nae au ana [journey]

16.english: Immediately he who received the five talents went and traded with them, and made another five talents.
16.wedau: maratagogi tauna aiyai [received]  [five] [talents] nae ma [traded] maitehi hita ma rura [another] [five] [talents]

17.english: In the same way, he also who got the two gained another two.
17.wedau: au  tagotagogi parata tauna maitehi aiyai varahai  [two] [gained] [another] [two]

18.english: But he who received the one talent went away and dug in the earth, and hid his lord’s money.
18.wedau: tuna tauna aiyai [received]  [one] [talent] nae [away] ma [dug] au  dobuna ma [hid] ana [lord’s] [money]

19.english: “Now after a long time the lord of those servants came, and reconciled accounts with them.
19.wedau: [“now] muriyai  [long] mara  Guyau ana raketana taunoya neꞌi ma [reconciled] [accounts] maitehi hita

20.english: He who received the five talents came and brought another five talents, saying, ‘Lord, you delivered to me five talents. Behold, I have gained another five talents in addition to them.’
20.wedau: tauna aiyai [received]  [five] [talents] neꞌi ma neiyahi [another] [five] [talents] riwa ipa [‘lord] omi [delivered] da tau [five] [talents] [behold] tau ana [gained] [another] [five] [talents] au [addition] da [them’]

21.english: “His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
21.wedau: [“his] Guyau riwa da tauna [‘well] [done] [good] ma [faithful] [servant] omi ana  [faithful] au  ghehauhi [things] tau ina [set] omi au anatapuhi [things] rui au  [joy] ana ami [lord’]

22.english: “He also who got the two talents came and said, ‘Lord, you delivered to me two talents. Behold, I have gained another two talents in addition to them.’
22.wedau: [“he] maitehi aiyai varahai  [two] [talents] neꞌi ma riwa [‘lord] omi [delivered] da tau [two] [talents] [behold] tau ana [gained] [another] [two] [talents] au [addition] da [them’]

23.english: “His lord said to him, ‘Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a few things, I will set you over many things. Enter into the joy of your lord.’
23.wedau: [“his] Guyau riwa da tauna [‘well] [done] [good] ma [faithful] [servant] omi ana  [faithful] au  ghehauhi [things] tau ina [set] omi au anatapuhi [things] rui au  [joy] ana ami [lord’]

24.english: “He also who had received the one talent came and said, ‘Lord, I knew you that you are a hard man, reaping where you didn’t sow, and gathering where you didn’t scatter.
24.wedau: [“he] maitehi aiyai ana [received]  [one] [talent] neꞌi ma riwa [‘lord] tau haramaneꞌi omi raketana omi   [hard] oroto [reaping] aiwaꞌi omi [didn’t] [sow] ma [gathering] aiwaꞌi omi [didn’t] [scatter]

25.english: I was afraid, and went away and hid your talent in the earth. Behold, you have what is yours.’
25.wedau: tau  [afraid] ma nae [away] ma [hid] ami [talent] au  dobuna [behold] omi ana aiwaꞌi  [yours’]

26.english: “But his lord answered him, ‘You wicked and slothful servant. You knew that I reap where I didn’t sow, and gather where I didn’t scatter.
26.wedau: [“but] ana Guyau [answered] tauna [‘you] [wicked] ma [slothful] [servant] omi haramaneꞌi raketana tau [reap] aiwaꞌi tau [didn’t] [sow] ma [gather] aiwaꞌi tau [didn’t] [scatter]

27.english: You ought therefore to have deposited my money with the bankers, and at my coming I should have received back my own with interest.
27.wedau: omi [ought] [therefore] da ana [deposited] au [money] maitehi  [bankers] ma au au naenae tau ina ana [received] [back] au ana maitehi [interest]

28.english: Take away therefore the talent from him, and give it to him who has the ten talents.
28.wedau: varahai [away] [therefore]  [talent] au tauna ma verei tauna da tauna aiyai ana  [ten] [talents]

29.english: For to everyone who has will be given, and he will have abundance, but from him who doesn’t have, even that which he has will be taken away.
29.wedau: yamna da anatapuhi aiyai ana ina  verei ma tauna ina ana [abundance] tuna au tauna aiyai [doesn’t] ana ma raketana aiyai tauna ana ina  varahai [away]

30.english: Throw out the unprofitable servant into the outer darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.’
30.wedau: [throw] hopu  [unprofitable] [servant] au  [outer] [darkness] aiwaꞌi kampa ina  [weeping] ma [gnashing] ana [teeth’]

31.english: “But when the Son of Man comes in his glory, and all the holy angels with him, then he will sit on the throne of his glory.
31.wedau: [“but] maranaina  natuna ana oroto neꞌi au ana [glory] ma anatapuhi  [holy] aneya maitehi tauna maratagogi tauna ina [sit] au  [throne] ana ana [glory]

32.english: Before him all the nations will be gathered, and he will separate them one from another, as a shepherd separates the sheep from the goats.
32.wedau: naona tauna anatapuhi  [nations] ina  tagogiyehi ma tauna ina [separate] hita [one] au [another]   [shepherd] [separates]  [sheep] au  [goats]

33.english: He will set the sheep on his right hand, but the goats on the left.
33.wedau: tauna ina [set]  [sheep] au ana [right] nimana tuna  [goats] au  voterei

34.english: Then the King will tell those on his right hand, ‘Come, blessed of my Father, inherit the Kingdom prepared for you from the foundation of the world;
34.wedau: I maratagogi  kingi ina riwehi raketana au ana [right] nimana [‘come] nuwaboyei ana au Tamatei ana vouna  vibadana [prepared] yamna omi au  [foundation] ana  [world;]
34.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Power (0.82); Strong secondary: Justice

35.english: for I was hungry, and you gave me food to eat. I was thirsty, and you gave me drink. I was a stranger, and you took me in.
35.wedau: yamna tau  [hungry] ma omi verei tau [food] da [eat] tau  [thirsty] ma omi verei tau [drink] tau   [stranger] ma omi varahai tau au

36.english: I was naked, and you clothed me. I was sick, and you visited me. I was in prison, and you came to me.’
36.wedau: tau  [naked] ma omi [clothed] tau tau  doridoriahi ma omi [visited] tau tau  au deri ma omi neꞌi da [me’]

37.english: “Then the righteous will answer him, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, and feed you; or thirsty, and give you a drink?
37.wedau: [“then]  [righteous] ina [answer] tauna riwa ipa [‘lord] maranaina rura ita inana omi [hungry] ma [feed] [you;] bo [thirsty] ma verei omi  [drink?]
37.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.86); Strong secondary: Wisdom

38.english: When did we see you as a stranger, and take you in; or naked, and clothe you?
38.wedau: maranaina rura ita inana omi   [stranger] ma varahai omi [in;] bo [naked] ma [clothe] [you?]

39.english: When did we see you sick, or in prison, and come to you?’
39.wedau: maranaina rura ita inana omi doridoriahi bo au deri ma neꞌi da [you?’]

40.english: “The King will answer them, ‘Most certainly I tell you, because you did it to one of the least of these my brothers, you did it to me.’
40.wedau: [“the] kingi ina [answer] hita [‘most] [certainly] tau riwehi omi yamna omi rura tauna da [one] ana  [least] ana ina au tevera omi rura tauna da [me’]

41.english: Then he will say also to those on the left hand, ‘Depart from me, you cursed, into the eternal fire which is prepared for the devil and his angels;
41.wedau: maratagogi tauna ina riwa maitehi da raketana au  voterei nimana [‘depart] au tau omi [cursed] au  [eternal] [fire] aiyai  [prepared] yamna  [devil] ma ana [angels;]
41.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Wisdom (0.50); Low harmony verse (distinctive emphasis)

42.english: for I was hungry, and you didn’t give me food to eat; I was thirsty, and you gave me no drink;
42.wedau: yamna tau  [hungry] ma omi [didn’t] verei tau [food] da [eat;] tau  [thirsty] ma omi verei tau egha [drink;]

43.english: I was a stranger, and you didn’t take me in; naked, and you didn’t clothe me; sick, and in prison, and you didn’t visit me.’
43.wedau: tau   [stranger] ma omi [didn’t] varahai tau [in;] [naked] ma omi [didn’t] [clothe] [me;] doridoriahi ma au deri ma omi [didn’t] [visit] [me’]

44.english: “Then they will also answer, saying, ‘Lord, when did we see you hungry, or thirsty, or a stranger, or naked, or sick, or in prison, and didn’t help you?’
44.wedau: [“then] tauhi ina maitehi [answer] riwa ipa [‘lord] maranaina rura ita inana omi [hungry] bo [thirsty] bo  [stranger] bo [naked] bo doridoriahi bo au deri ma [didn’t] [help] [you?’]

45.english: “Then he will answer them, saying, ‘Most certainly I tell you, because you didn’t do it to one of the least of these, you didn’t do it to me.’
45.wedau: [“then] tauna ina [answer] hita riwa ipa [‘most] [certainly] tau riwehi omi yamna omi [didn’t] rura tauna da [one] ana  [least] ana ina omi [didn’t] rura tauna da [me’]

46.english: These will go away into eternal punishment, but the righteous into eternal life.”
46.wedau: ina ina nae [away] au [eternal] [punishment] tuna  [righteous] au [eternal] [life”]
46.translation_notes: Primary dimension: Justice (0.71); Strong secondary: Wisdom
